newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Integrated Systems down.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Integrated Systems down.

text.p: Integrated Systems Inc fell to 10 in after-hours trading from its close of 13-15/16 on the Nasdaq after it said it expected lower first-quarter earnings, dealers said Tuesday.
The software developer said it expected to report earnings between $0.01 a share and $0.03 a share for the first quarter of fiscal 1998.
First Call's consensus among analysts had forecast its earnings at $0.06 a share.
Another trader said most of stocks remained fairly quiet.
"There's really nothing that's jumping," he said.
The New York Stock Exchange said Tuesday that session one had a volume of 156,000 shares, compared with a much smaller 12,600. Session two had 4.3 million against 481,500, it said.
